Week 4 WR/TE Market Share Reports!üìàüìâüèà

-Sensing a connection w/ Fields & Mooney; led CHI in targets during Fields W2 cameo üòç
-Reek rebounds big, McLaurin certified weekly WR1 lock üîê
-Love Kittle's workload, hate the productionü§∑‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è
Data: @nflfastR #RStats #nflverse https://t.co/kXXANQJNYa

2021 WR/TE Market Share Reports!üìàüìâüèà

-Will Jakobi Meyers find paydirt? 
-Target hogs separating from the pack
-Boyd getting fed w/o Higgins
-Woods staying relevant w/ TDs, but usage concerning
-Dawson Knox certainly in the TE1 conversation 
Data: @nflfastR #RStats #nflverse https://t.co/U2VkkAcWlW

Week 4 of NFL QB DICK Size... Scoring each QB by their Air Yards and Passing Touchdowns. Now includes week to week DICK movement. 

#nflverse #python #matplotlib https://t.co/MvRuCFmgwn

Week 4 Defensive EPA/P removing turnovers... Is the Cowboys defense for real or just benefiting from early season turnover luck? Red color in the DIFF column means defensive success heavily relies on turnovers. #python #matplotlib 

Data: #nflverse https://t.co/BtmhWiKffl

Lamar wasn't holding onto the ball unusually long in Week 4 like he did in Week 3, but his aDOT was still top 5 in his career. The big Q: will he continue to push the ball downfield, or is this just a by-product of recent defensive game plans? #nflverse https://t.co/JWE1DYPVqc

We're through Week 4 and the model has finally learned that the @steelers are probably awful üò¢ 

Full season proj are in line with other systems, but my model doesn't love the @BuffaloBills, with slightly more than half the prob of a SB win compared to @FiveThirtyEight #nflverse https://t.co/2zq0HR3AuR https://t.co/l40Cs2XFNx

On a weekly projection level, the model did a nice job of picking winners last week, though it was overconfident on the wrong games - looking at you @MiamiDolphins, and I need to revisit the weight of pre-season team strength estimates, but here are this week's picks #nflverse https://t.co/MZA3QYfHo8
Last but not least, team strength estimates #nflverse https://t.co/o1YfVEfDiF
@danmorse_ @mrcaseb i support the #nflverse because it's brave enough to state publicly that sam darnold is bad

Your weekly pending-SNF-and-MNF punter EPA rankings!

ü¶µJACK FOX IS BACK FOLKS soak it in #OnePride 
ü¶µBojo continues to be a brilliant signing
ü¶µYoungsters Logan Cooke and AJ Cole III are thriving
ü¶µMichael Dickson quietly climbing after a rocky start

#nflverse https://t.co/odMcOYqdtk

*small sample size alert*
here's how quarterbacks have done so far in 2021 on plays where the chance they pass is greater than 60% (this includes mostly passes but also sacks and runs) #nflverse https://t.co/pWEv1aV7B1 https://t.co/z5bGJmQxle
through the first four weeks of the season, no one has had a higher average depth of target on completed passes than lamar jackson #nflverse https://t.co/kTTEeSdFI6

PSA: The nflfastR roster data in the #nflverse now provides headshot urls and pff ids for most 2021 rookies. 
Get them with `nflreadr::load_rosters()`

https://t.co/fjVhzsLVWj

Week 4 of NFL QB DICK Size... Scoring each QB by their Air Yards and Passing Touchdowns. Now includes week to week DICK movement. 

#nflverse #python #matplotlib https://t.co/MvRuCFmgwn

Sometimes you have an interesting question: What do 1st round rookie QB's EPA / play look like throughout their first season. 

And then you create a pretty graph that offers almost no conclusion. üòû

#nflverse https://t.co/cOuAtpTOOk

Two pretty charts showing ugly Bears data. Since Matt Nagy took over his offense has been a bottom 10 unit in both pass/rush EPA. 

It's time for an upgrade

#nflverse https://t.co/46J9aytdyF
@CowboysStats @adriancm93 Wow @CowboysStats might be the biggest Mike McCarthy fan in the #nflverse

Through 4 weeks, the worst performing QB in the AFC North has been Ben Roethlisberger, and by a wide margin. Burrow, Jackson, and Mayfield have put together a body of impressive work despite some hiccups here and there. #nflverse https://t.co/wAcQF6dT8Q

Some progress here for the #Steelers on their first down play calls yesterday. Averaged a gain of 4.4 yards. 5 of a possible 25 plays were for either no gain or negative yardage. 10 runs, 15 pass. 
Avg. EPA on runs: .00672
Avg. EPA on pass: -.027
#nflverse https://t.co/R9yBGw15ap

#Steelers had a marked improvement in running the ball against the #Packers yesterday. Best run came through the ends, but most attempts seemed to be behind the guards. #nflverse https://t.co/xVlanGK7Lc
The only thing sadder than talking about your fantasy team is building an analytics site for your fantasy league #kfl #nflverse #ffverse

The magic number in the KFL is 85 points. Score 85 points or more and you have a higher than 50% probability of winning the week. Data based on 2018-2020 seasons. More coming on the KFL analytics blog launching soon. #KFL #ffverse #nflverse https://t.co/nh3aI7x76M

Working on some win probability and match-up luck in the KFL. Over the last three years, Nick's Fighting Ducks and Jeff's Slugs tied for the honor of luckiest win. Both won scoring a measly 47 points which gave them just a 4.8% chance of victory. #ffverse #nflverse #KFL https://t.co/YLSvHVvgF2
@KFL_analytics #kfl #nflverse #ffverse I did Pythagorean wins for my league to see if I really was always catching everyone on their best week ever

I made an app so you can compare QB air yard distributions over specified periods of time.

#nflverse

https://t.co/URUlK7a6aj https://t.co/o5nEdz6vSc

The NE offense has lost nearly an entire win worth of win probability on turnovers, almost 20 percentage points more than any Pats team through four weeks in the #nflverse era.

https://t.co/awzuROXh1R https://t.co/UqZBnaf1ue https://t.co/JHxqQWChql

Pass & Rush EPA charts updated for week 3

#tableau #nflverse

Link üëá
https://t.co/sgQwnha8pK https://t.co/do3kOktKGF

@LaverneusDingle @SeanfromSeabeck Yeah this.

Certainly among #nflverse folks one of a lot of the stuff that's come up has been wants from fantasy folks even though originally that wasn't the imagined use case.

As of week 3, though, the model is in love with @BuffaloBills and @RamsNFL, giving each of them a +13% chance of winning the SB, in line with @FiveThirtyEight ELO model #nflverse https://t.co/3pvpaMvRgy

The model faired well in Week 3, calling more games correctly than the market in @LeeSharpeNFL prediction game, though the uncertainty made it less confident, resulting in fewer points :( - though that should change this week with more confidence in team strength #nflverse https://t.co/yg3xtu40ht
Speaking of team strength - the model is starting to create more separation from the haves and the have-nots #nflverse https://t.co/3dNb4zHbtT

#Giants 3/3 on 3rd down to Golladay, still throwing behind the maker too much!

2021 season, after 4 games:
-Throw behind marker: 3/13 (23%)
-Throw at marker: 3/9 (33%)
-Throw past marker: 10/12 (83%)
@nflfastR #RStats #nflverse https://t.co/TPSq4pGqai

QB Adjusted EPA per Play through week 3. The first chart shows 2021 EPA/play vs. career EPA/play; the second chart shows EPA/play for 2021 games vs. career EPA/play - which highlights outlier games and regression to career average. #nflverse https://t.co/sPaDiDzBTe

The Saints +5 turnover differential has given them a net of 35 expected points, while the Jaguars have lost 36 expected points from turnovers/takeaways.

Data: #nflverse https://t.co/QpL9jdYgMo

Week 4 will have some of the biggest "Revenge Games" of the season: Tom Brady, Gronk, Derek Wolfe, Jacoby Brissett, Corey Davis, Casey Hayward, Denzel Perryman, and others will be facing off against their former teams.

Data: #nflverse https://t.co/PsJVeX8ij8

Really enjoyed the deep dive into Big Ben's career. Seeing the decline so sharply around his elbow injury is heart breaking, but this is where we are at. The Steelers need to move on and it shows.

#nflverse #RStats #nflfastr https://t.co/NQSokn278P

Lamar was slinging the ball downfield against the Lions in a way he never has before. With an average time to throw of 3.9 seconds and an average intended air yards of 19.3, per NextGenStats, Lamar's Week 3 performance stands apart from the rest of his career so far #nflverse https://t.co/sqVSsWR6Yv

Lamar wasn't holding onto the ball unusually long in Week 4 like he did in Week 3, but his aDOT was still top 5 in his career. The big Q: will he continue to push the ball downfield, or is this just a by-product of recent defensive game plans? #nflverse https://t.co/JWE1DYPVqc

THINGS YOU LOVE TO SEE: IT üëá

#rstats #nflverse https://t.co/NcxGnTI4nV

Stream notes for this weekend: 

Tonight (8pm EDT) and tomorrow (11am EDT): working on #nflverse data pipelines and automation! Possibly also bugfixing some Shiny apps!

TOMORROW NIGHT AT 8PM: PUMPKIN CARVING STREAMSüéÉ

https://t.co/byE0SlXj3e

#nflverse #rstats https://t.co/RBTaOcyfTN
